Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.
And, even, also, namely.

12.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
12.str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.
And, even, also, namely.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.

12.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
12.str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

12.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
12.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

12.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Neuter Plural
12.str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.

Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
